definitions.definition: Foyer
An inhabitant of a place; one who dwells in.
definitions.example: The giant squid is one of many denizens of the deep.

definitions.definition: One who frequents a place.
definitions.example: The denizens of that pub are of the roughest sort.

definitions.definition: A person with rights between those of naturalized citizen and resident alien (roughly permanent resident), obtained through letters patent.
definitions.example: Though born in Iceland, he became a denizen of Britain after leaving Oxford.

definitions.definition: An animal or plant from a particular range or habitat.
definitions.example: The bald eagle is a denizen of the northern part of the state.

definitions.definition: A foreign word that has become naturalised in another language.
To grant rights of citizenship to; to naturalize.
definitions.example: He was denizened to Ireland after fleeing his home country.

definitions.definition: To provide with denizens; to populate with adopted or naturalized occupants.
A Vietnamese soup with a beef base, typically served with rice noodles and beef or chicken.
A reversal of policy, attitude or principle.
Having both eyes oriented inward, cross-eyed.
Crooked or askew.
Absurd, silly, or stupid; usually used in reference to ideas rather than people.
definitions.example: I'm not going to go along with your cockeyed plot.

definitions.definition: Drunk.

A person who holds open the door at the entrance to a building, summons taxicabs, and provides an element of security; in apartment buildings, he also accepts deliveries and may perform certain concierge type services.
Playing at courtship; coquetry.
An instance of flirting.
A New Zealander.
A flightless bird of the genus Apteryx native to New Zealand.
A New Zealand dollar.
A kiwi fruit.
A green-yellow colour, like that of kiwi flesh (also called kiwi green).
A member of the air force who does not fly.
A tropical plant, Ananas comosus, native to South America, having thirty or more long, spined and pointed leaves surrounding a thick stem.
The ovoid fruit of the pineapple plant, which has very sweet white or yellow flesh, a tough, spiky shell and a tough, fibrous core.
The flesh of a pineapple fruit used as a food item.
An Australian fifty dollar note.
A web burrfish (Chilomycterus antillarum, syn. Chilomycterus geometricus)
A light yellow colour, like that of pineapple flesh (also called pineapple yellow).
A pinecone.
A decorative carving of a pineapple fruit used as a symbol of hospitality.
A hand grenade.
A hairstyle consisting of a ponytail worn on top of the head, imitating the leaves of a pineapple.
An open shed for sheltering cattle, or protecting produce, etc., from the weather.
A poor cottage; a small, mean house; a hut.
In the manufacture of porcelain, a large, conical brick structure around which the firing kilns are grouped.
To put in a hovel; to shelter.
To construct a chimney so as to prevent smoking, by making two of the more exposed walls higher than the others, or making an opening on one side near the top.
A large building which contains offices on several floors, often for several firms.
One who has done something offensive; a deceitful, dishonest, or disreputable person; a deceiver; a cheat.
A rogue; rascal; miscreant; a ne'er-do-well.
Dishonest; resulting from or inspired by dishonesty.
One who drives a truck, especially as an occupation.
One who trucks or trafficks, by trade of goods; a trafficker.
definitions.example: No man having ever yet driven a saving bargain with this great trucker for souls. — South.

definitions.definition: The care of women during and after pregnancy
A female school crossing attendant.
(grammar) A word that modifies a noun or describes a noun’s referent.
definitions.example: The words “big” and “heavy” are English adjectives.

definitions.definition: A dependent; an accessory.
To make an adjective of; to form or convert into an adjective.
(chiefly as a participle) To characterize with an adjective; to describe by using an adjective.
Incapable of independent function.
(grammar) Adjectival; pertaining to or functioning as an adjective.
Applying to methods of enforcement and rules of procedure.
(of a dye) Needing the use of a mordant to be made fast to that which is being dyed.
To remove the outer covering or shell of something.
To bombard, to fire projectiles at, especially with artillery.
To disburse or give up money, to pay. (Often used with out).
To fall off, as a shell, crust, etc.
To cast the shell, or exterior covering; to fall out of the pod or husk.
definitions.example: Nuts shell in falling.

definitions.definition: To switch to a shell or command line.
To form shallow, irregular cracks (in a coating).
To form a shelling.
An artillery bombardment.
The removal of the shell from a nut, pea etc.
Grain from which the husk has been removed.

An ordering of the facets of a boundary complex such that the intersection of each facet (other than the first) with the union of all preceding facets is homeomorphic to a ball or sphere. See Shelling (topology)
Shallow, irregular cracks that appear on the surface of a coating such as plaster or mortar.
To make extremely thin or wasted.
To become extremely thin or wasted.
Thin or haggard, especially from hunger or disease.
definitions.example: The emaciated prisoners in the death camps were weak and sickly.

definitions.definition: The study of iterative non-linear systems in which arbitrarily small variations in initial conditions become magnified over time.
A serviette; a (usually rectangular) piece of cloth or paper used at the table for wiping the mouth and hands for cleanliness while eating.
A nappy (UK), a diaper (American).
A small scarf worn on the head by Christian women (chiefly Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox) when entering a church, as a token of modesty.
A sanitary napkin.
Heat stroke caused by an excessive exposure to the sun's rays.
To take the property of another, often in breach of trust; to appropriate wrongfully; to steal.
To commit theft; to thieve.
A paint in which the colours or pigments are suspended in an oil-based carrier such as linseed oil which hardens on exposure to the air.
A place that sells items, especially cars.
definitions.example: I visited the car dealership today.

definitions.definition: Powder obtained by grinding or milling cereal grains, especially wheat, or other foodstuffs such as soybeans and potatoes, and used to bake bread, cakes, and pastry.

The food made by grinding and bolting cleaned wheat (not durum or red durum) until it meets specified levels of fineness, dryness and freedom from bran and germ, also containing any of certain enzymes, ascorbic acid and certain bleaching agents.
Powder of other material.
definitions.example: mustard flour

definitions.definition: A colorful, conspicuous structure associated with angiosperms, frequently scented and attracting various insects, and which may or may not be used for sexual reproduction.
A reproductive structure in angiosperms (flowering plants), often conspicuously colourful and typically including sepals, petals, and either or both stamens and/or a pistil.
A plant that bears flowers, especially a plant that is small and lacks wood.
definitions.example: We transplanted the flowers to a larger pot.

definitions.definition: (usually with in) Of plants, a state of bearing blooms.
definitions.example: The dogwoods are in flower this week.

definitions.definition: (hypocoristic) The vulva, especially the labia majora.
The best examples or representatives of a group.
definitions.example: We selected the flower of the applicants.

definitions.definition: The best state of things; the prime.
definitions.example: She was in the flower of her life.

definitions.definition: Flour.
(in the plural) A substance in the form of a powder, especially when condensed from sublimation.
definitions.example: the flowers of sulphur

definitions.definition: A figure of speech; an ornament of style.
Ornamental type used chiefly for borders around pages, cards, etc.
(in the plural) Menstrual discharges.
Something that flows, such as a river.
A wheat flour with a medium gluten content, suitable for general use. Equivalent to American English "all-purpose flour".
A vessel equipped for the removal of sand or sediment from the seabed.
One who fishes with a dredge.
A dredging machine.
A container with a perforated lid, used to sprinkle sugar or flour.
A duct that transports tears from the lacrimal sac to the nasal cavity
Resembling a colt, especially:
The highest rank in the Royal Navy and other navies, NATO grade OF-10, usually reserved for wartime and ceremonial use.
Fleet admiral
The act of coming in; arrival.
Enemy fire directed at oneself.
Coming (or about to come) in; arriving.
definitions.example: Incoming tides cause a tidal bore in many rivers.

definitions.definition: Succeeding to an office.
definitions.example: The incoming prime minister gave a press conference.

definitions.definition: A warning that something is coming towards you; especially enemy artillery fire
A leave of absence or vacation.
The documents authorizing such leave.
A period of unpaid time off, used by an employer to reduce costs.
To grant a furlough to (someone).
To have (an employee) not work in order to reduce costs; to send (someone) on furlough.
A headband; a ribbon or other band used to tie the hair up, or keep a headdress in place, or for decoration.
A fine strip of any material, in various technical uses.
A heavy bead of waterproofing compound or sealant material generally installed at the point where vertical and horizontal surfaces meet.
(drafting, CAD) A rounded relief or cut at an edge, especially an inside edge, added for a finished appearance and to break sharp edges.
A strip or compact piece of meat or fish from which any bones and skin and feathers have been removed.
A fine flat moulding/molding used as separation between coarser mouldings.
The space between two flutings in a shaft.
An ordinary equal in breadth to one quarter of the chief, to the lowest portion of which it corresponds in position.
The thread of a screw.
A colored or gilded border.
The raised moulding around the muzzle of a gun.
Any scantling smaller than a batten.
A fascia; a band of fibres; applied especially to certain bands of white matter in the brain.
The loins of a horse, beginning at the place where the hinder part of the saddle rests.
To slice, bone or make into fillets.
To apply, create, or specify a rounded or filled corner to.
The state of being insane; madness.
To adapt to; to learn, grasp or master.
definitions.example: Although he had never skated before, he took to it quickly, and soon glided around the ice with ease.

definitions.definition: To enter; to go into or move towards.
definitions.example: As the train rushed through, thousands of birds took to the air at once.

definitions.definition: To begin, as a new habit or practice.
definitions.example: After the third one was rejected, she took to asking the department to check the form before she submitted it.

definitions.definition: (of persons) To be attracted to.
A frog that skips the tadpole stage and emerges as a fully developed frog.
A little or insignificant French person.
Anything made wholly or largely of iron, especially when used for decoration.
An ironworks.
A factory in which iron is manufactured or iron goods are made
A female usher.
A school that teaches medicine.
Approval, agreement, or instruction to begin or proceed.
definitions.example: You can start as soon as you get the go-ahead from the president.

definitions.definition: Progressive; exerting leadership.
definitions.example: I work for a very go-ahead company that's always looking for new ideas.

definitions.definition: Dashing; energetic.
Being a score which gives the scoring team or player the lead in the game.
definitions.example: The pitcher gave up the go-ahead run in the top of the ninth inning.

definitions.definition: Power, prestige; specifically, a form of supernatural energy in Polynesian religion that inheres in things or people.
Magical power.
A monetary unit of ancient Greece and the Middle East, originally equivalent to the weight of a mina of silver.
A unit of weight of varying value used in the ancient Middle East, especially Babylonia, Mesopotamia and Egypt; also an ancient Greek measure of weight equivalent to 1/60th of a talent.
One of the South and East Asian birds of the starling family Sturnidae.
Food miraculously produced for the Israelites in the desert in the book of Exodus.
(by extension) Any boon which comes into one's hands by good luck.
The sugary sap of the manna gum tree which oozes out from holes drilled by insects and falls to the ground around the tree.http//www.museum.vic.gov.au/forest/plants/gum.html
A hard, dense, deep black wood from various subtropical and tropical trees, especially of the genus Diospyros.
A tree that yields such wood.
A deep, dark black colour.
A black key on a piano or other keyboard instrument.
Made of ebony wood.
A deep, dark black colour.
Dark-skinned; black; especially in reference to African-Americans.
A garnish of vegetables cut into long, thin strips.
To prepare by cutting in this way.
Loss of or deficiency in the power to use or understand language as a result of injury or disease of the brain.
A prehistoric chisel-bladed tool.
The number or expression written above the line in a fraction (such as 1 in ½).
An enumerator; someone who counts things.

The monomer constituting DNA or RNA biopolymer molecules. Each nucleotide consists of a nitrogenous heterocyclic base (or nucleobase), which can be either a double-ringed purine or a single-ringed pyrimidine; a five-carbon pentose sugar (deoxyribose in DNA or ribose in RNA); and a phosphate group.
A workshop or studio, especially for an artist, designer or fashion house.
The ceremonial meal held on the first night or two nights of Passover.
One of the 54 parts into which the Torah is divided.
A toad of species Bufo calamita (or Epidalea calamita), known for its running lizard-like gait and very loud mating call.
Someone who threads something; one who makes or provides strings, especially for bows.
Someone who strings someone along.
A horizontal timber that supports upright posts, or supports the hull of a vessel.
The side rail supporting the rungs of a ladder or the steps of a flight of stairs.
A small screw-hook to which piano strings are sometimes attached.
A freelance correspondent not on the regular newspaper staff, especially one retained on a part-time basis to report on events in a particular place.
A person who plays on a particular string.
Wooden strip running lengthwise down the centre of a surfboard, for strength.
definitions.example: Line up the 1/2 template with the stringer (or draw a center line) — Stephen Pirsch http//www.surfersteve.com/shaping.htm

definitions.definition: (1800s) A hard-hit ball.
A cord or chain, sometimes with additional loops, that is threaded through the mouth and gills of caught fish.

A pallet or skid used when shipping less than truckload (LTL) freight. A platform typically constructed of timber or plastic designed such that freight may be stacked on top, able to be lifted by a forklift.
A libertine; a wencher.
A person who deliberately states that a certain bird is present when it is not; one who knowingly misleads other birders about the occurrence of a bird, especially a rarity.
To surprise greatly.
Amazed; surprised.
A medical doctor who treats animals.
Veterinary
To express with the voice, to utter.
(of animals) To produce noises or calls from the throat.
definitions.example: We could hear the monkeys vocalizing, though we could not see them.

definitions.definition: To sing without using words.
To turn a consonant into a vowel.
definitions.example: In Hong Kong English, /l/ may be vocalized at the end of a syllable.

definitions.definition: To make a sound voiced rather than voiceless.
To add vowel points to a consonantal script (e.g. niqqud in Hebrew)
A vocal exercise performed by singing one or more vowels without actually forming any words.
An apartment in a palace or great house for use on ceremonial occasions.
A superior cabin for a ship's officer or captain.
A private cabin in a ship or train.
To pay out (money).
definitions.example: He spends far more on gambling than he does on living proper.

definitions.definition: To bestow; to employ; often with on or upon.
To squander.
definitions.example: to spend an estate in gambling

definitions.definition: To exhaust, to wear out.
definitions.example: The violence of the waves was spent.

definitions.definition: To consume, to use up (time).
definitions.example: My sister usually spends her free time in nightclubs.

definitions.definition: To have an orgasm; to ejaculate sexually.
definitions.example: The fish spends his semen on eggs which he finds floating and whose mother he has never seen.

definitions.definition: To waste or wear away; to be consumed.
definitions.example: Energy spends in the using of it.

definitions.definition: To be diffused; to spread.
To break ground; to continue working.
Consumed, used up, exhausted, depleted.
definitions.example: a spent cartridge

definitions.definition: Of fish: exhausted as a result of having spawned.
Degradation, debasement or humiliation
An affront to one's dignity or pride
A place where rubbish is placed.
A business that sells used metal or items.
Any persistent wind from the east (usually applied to broad currents or belts of easterly winds).
Facing the east; directed towards the east.
definitions.example: an easterly course or voyage

definitions.definition: Located towards the east.
definitions.example: the easterly side of a lake

definitions.definition: Coming from the east.
definitions.example: an easterly wind

definitions.definition: In an eastward direction or position; towards the east.
From the east.
In bookkeeping, an entry in the left hand column of an account.
definitions.example: A cash sale is recorded as debit on the cash account and as credit on the sales account.

definitions.definition: A sum of money taken out of a bank account. Thus called, because in bank's bookkeeping a cash withdrawal diminishes the amount of money held on the account, i.e. bank's debt to the customer.
To make an entry on the debit side of an account.
To record a receivable in the bookkeeping.
definitions.example: We shall debit the amount of your purchase to your account.

definitions.definition: Of or relating to process of taking money from an account
Of or relating to the debit card function of a debit card rather than its often available credit card function
Ostentatious display of richness or style.
Shiny jewelry that displays wealth, such as a diamond ring or a stylish gold necklace or bracelet.
A civilian employed by the police to regulate traffic and issue parking tickets.
A beast of burden, much used in desert areas, of the genus Camelus.
A light brownish color, like that of a camel (also called camel brown).
Loaded vessels lashed tightly, one on each side of another vessel, and then emptied to reduce the draught of the ship in the middle.
Of a light brown color like that of a camel.

A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal; yellow fur patterned with dark spots, often in the form of a network; and two or more short, skin-covered horns, so-called; strictly speaking the horn-like projections are ossicones.
A giraffe unicycle.
A laugh.
definitions.example: Are you having a giraffe?!

definitions.definition: Having a gender expression not in accordance with traditional masculine or feminine gender norms
Decoration; especially, decoration placed along edges or borders.
definitions.example: Paint the house white with blue trim.

definitions.definition: A haircut, especially a moderate one to touch up an existing style.
definitions.example: I went to the hairdresser for a trim but came back nearly bald.

definitions.definition: Dress; gear; ornaments.
The manner in which something is equipped or adorned; order; disposition.
definitions.example: The car comes in three different trims.

definitions.definition: Sexual intercourse.
The fore-and-aft angle of the vessel to the water, with reference to the cargo and ballast; the manner in which a vessel floats on the water, whether on an even keel or down by the head or stern.
The arrangement of the sails with reference to the wind.
To reduce slightly; to cut; especially, to remove excess.
definitions.example: A ranch steak is usually trimmed of all excess fat.

definitions.definition: To decorate or adorn; especially of a Christmas tree.
definitions.example: They traditionally trim the tree on Christmas Eve.

definitions.definition: (of an aircraft) To adjust pitch using trim tabs.
(of a vessel) To modify the angle relative to the water by shifting cargo or ballast; to adjust for sailing; to assume, or cause to assume a certain position, or trim, in the water.
(of a vessel's sails) To modify the angle (of the sails) relative to the wind, especially to set them at the most advantageous angle.
To balance; to fluctuate between parties, so as to appear to favour each.
To make trim; to put in due order for any purpose; to make right, neat, or pleasing; to adjust.
(of timber) To dress; to make smooth.
To rebuke; to reprove.
To beat or thrash.
Physically fit.
definitions.example: He goes jogging every day to keep in trim.

definitions.definition: Slender, lean.
definitions.example: a trim figure

definitions.definition: Neat or smart in appearance.
definitions.example: a trim lawn

definitions.definition: In good order; properly managed or maintained.
With sails well trimmed.
A clause, phrase or word which is inserted (usually for explanation or amplification) into a passage which is already grammatically complete, and usually marked off with brackets, commas or dashes.
Either of a pair of brackets, especially round brackets, ( and ) (used to enclose parenthetical material in a text).
A digression; the use of such digressions.
Such brackets as used to clarify expressions by grouping those terms affected by a common operator, or to enclose the components of a vector or the elements of a matrix.
The act of throwing or darting out with a sudden force and rapid flight.
The uttering of a short, sudden exclamation or prayer, or the exclamation or prayer uttered.
The act of ejecting or suddenly throwing, as a fluid from a duct or other body structure.
A Polish folk dance in triple time, usually moderately fast, containing a heavy accent on the third beat and occasionally the second beat.
A classical musical composition inspired by the folk dance and conforming in some respects to its form, particularly as popularized by Chopin.
A figure skating move that combines elements of the toe loop and bunny-hop.
Having the characteristics of a sheep.
Shy, meek, shameful or embarrassed.
A portable stereo system capable of playing music (from several sources) at a relatively high volume; a boom box.
A person suffering from schizophrenia.
Of or relating to schizophrenia.
(of a person) Afflicted with schizophrenia; having difficulty with perception of reality.
Behaving as if one has more than one personality; wildly changeable.
A storm consisting of thunder and lightning produced by a cumulonimbus, usually accompanied with heavy rain, wind, and sometimes hail; and in rarer cases sleet, freezing rain, or snow.
That which persuades; incitement.
Able to persuade; convincing
Descending by means of a rope, abseiling.
To abseil.
To call back a hawk.
A drumbeat pattern for calling soldiers to gather.
Incapable of producing results; doomed not to be successful; not worth attempting.
The quality of being genuine or not corrupted from the original.
definitions.example: I hereby certify the authenticity of this copy.

definitions.definition: Truthfulness of origins, attributions, commitments, sincerity, and intentions.
definitions.example: The authenticity of this painting is questionable.

definitions.definition: The quality of being authentic (of established authority).
A person who builds or constructs things.
Master artisan, who receives his instructions from the architect, and employs workers.
A bodybuilder.
Tedious details; minutiae.
To consider or argue about fine details; to worry about minutiae.
definitions.example: Let's get everything sorted into the right drawers and not split hairs about subdividing it further yet.

definitions.definition: A style of electronic music focusing heavily on loud bass and fast-tempo drumbeats.
The study of saints and the documentation of their lives.
A biography of a saint.
A biography which expresses reverence and respect for its subject.
A biography which is uncritically supportive of its subject, often including embellishments or propaganda.
A show that travels from place to place.
To show in various places as part of a travelling excursion.
